results.title: The Changing earth
results.creator_credit: Bert Haanstra, Sir Arthur Hallam Elton and Shell Film Unit
results.brief_description: Shows how the structure of the earth has been continuously changing from the start of geological time. The action of natural forces, heat, wind, rain and ice cause rocks to crumble, forming silt which is carried down into the ocean to form layers of sediment on the sea bed. Pressure of further layers deposited above, produces the rocks in which oil is slowly formed from the remains of the marine life. Animated diagrams show how the oil under pressure tends to migrate through the rocks, until it either finds its way through to the surface or is trapped in one of the formations for which oil-seekers look.

results.title: The Changing cotton land: USA - the southeast
results.creator_credit: Bill Colleran, Louis De Rochemont and United World Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Earth and it’s peoples”.
In this section of southeast America, cotton and tobacco have depleted the soil over a long period of time and the damage done is now being slowly repaired. new crops and new industries are being introduced. The film shows something of the work of the county agent at Laurel, Mississippi, who visits every farm and aids the farmer in improving the crops and livestock. Students at the State Agricultural College experiment with seeds, soil analysis, etc. Crops include pecan trees, tung trees, legume crops, sweet potatoes etc. A program of conservation of the forests is in operation, and the saw mills turn out wood fibre for composition board. Textile factories from the north provide additional employment.

results.title: Changes, changes
results.creator_credit: Gene Deitch, Morton Schindel and Weston Woods Studios
results.brief_description: Set to the music of an all-wood orchestra, this simple un-narrated story portrays a pair of wooden dolls magically come to life. Initially the blocks formed a house for the man and lady. They then change into a fire engine to put out a fire in the house and into a truck, train and ship to take the wooden couple on a holiday. Finally they form a house again. Adapted from the book of the same title by Pat Hutchins. Animation by Zdenka Skripkova. Suitable for lower and middle primary levels.

results.title: The Changeover
results.creator_credit: Eileen Molony and British Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Discovery and Experience”.
As there is growing emphasis in education on what a child does rather than what the teacher says, a gradual change in teaching methods and class management has taken place. Discusses new concepts in teaching, teacher training, classroom organisation and the attitude of the teacher to the children. Suitable for teacher training.

results.title: Change in the Maritimes
results.creator_credit: Robin Spry, Joseph Koenig and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: This film examines the changing economy of Canada’s Atlantic provinces and the factors that contributed to the expansion of industry in the early to mid-1960s. The film focuses primarily on the choice confronting many inshore fishermen - whether to stay with the free but frugal life that their nets provide, or to move to the city. Suitable for upper primary and lower secondary levels.

results.title: Change and employment
results.creator_credit: Anvil Films and British Productivity Council
results.brief_description: This film surveys the effects of technological change on employment security. Examines the ways in which management can meet the human problems involved by anticipating the introduction of automation and by training redundant employees in other skills. It contrasts the mass unemployment of the pre-war period with the post-war conditions of full employment.

results.title: A Chance to save a life
results.brief_description: This film demonstrates the mouth-to-mouth resuscitation technique and points out how lives may be saved by prompt action in common accidents. Please note that some of this information is out of date (1998).

results.title: A Chance to learn
results.creator_credit: Fred Moore, Leon Clore, Basic Films and British Productivity Council
results.brief_description: The advantages gained by industry from a systematic training of operators. A middle-aged woman, discontented because the personnel officer regards training as an expensive gimmick, takes another job where, given the chance to learn, her whole attitude changes. A small garment factory adopts a training program which becomes an indispensable part of normal activities.

results.title: Championship basketball highlights: 1975-76
results.brief_description: Includes highlights of the various basketball competitions in the USA during 1975-76. The Junior College Basketball Championship, the NAIA Championship, the NCAA Division II Championship, the AIAW National Championship, the NCAA University Division Championship, the NBA and the ABA Championship are all covered. Interspersed with these is a segment on a basketball camp, in Homesdale, Penn., the talented Tripuca family, and the Converse All America Team.
